page.title: 01KING LUD'S AREA near Saltby.
page.content: Situated east and south-east of Croxton Kerrial, and north-east of Saltby, the area consists essentially of a limestone plateau situated at an elevation of 150 metres above sea level. Consisting almost entirely of farmland, mainly non-grass crops, the area has a history going back possibly as far as the Bronze Age in the form of ancient roads and with archaeological remains possibly from the Dark Ages. In more recent times farmland was taken over for a 2nd World War airfield; this is now being reclaimed for farm- and woodland. The geological and geographical situation has made the area an important one from the point of view of limestone grassland conservation.
